column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////We ordered a handful of tapas and shared them family-style (fittingly). I'm not sure I remember everything we got
column2: but I'll comment on what I remember. Braised lamb was okay
column3: kind of bland. Spicy potatoes were flavorful and aioli was light and complementary. Beef empanada... I've had better. The crust was kinda light and the beef wasn't that amazing. Ham and chicken croquetas were perfectly fried and pretty delicious. I know we ordered more
column4: but that's all I really remember eating
column5: but in all it was pretty good overall. Service was really quick
